notesStmt.note: Incomplete at the beginning and at the end. Parchment damaged by damp. Tidemarks at edges. Losses to rodents at top corner, general dirt and stains. Occasional mould spotting. Some losses of text due to old repairs. Folio 214 preserved only partially.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each, marked by catchwords at the end and by an enumeration in Hebrew letters at the beginning.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square and semi-cursive script of the 14th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Dark brown leather, blind tooled, with clasps. Boxed. Spine: 'Abu Walid. Kitab Al-Usul. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Or. 4837.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Heller & Weiss: purchased from them by the British Museum on 14 November 1895: inscribed, flyleaf [viii]v.
